Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

DD_Attribute_Full.name: packet_map_mask
DD_Attribute_Full.definition: The PACKET_MAP_MASK element is a binary or hexadecimal number identifying which of a data file's expected packets were actually received. The digits correspond positionally with the relative packet numbers of the data file. The bits are to be read left to right; i.e., the first (left-most) digit of the number corresponds to the first packet of the data file. A bit value of 1 indicates that the packet was received; a value of 0 indicates that it was not received. The number is stored in the PDS radix notation of <radix>#<value>#.

Terminological_Entry.name: packet_map_mask
Terminological_Entry.definition: The PACKET_MAP_MASK element is a binary or hexadecimal number identifying which of a data file's expected packets were actually received. The digits correspond positionally with the relative packet numbers of the data file. The bits are to be read left to right; i.e., the first (left-most) digit of the number corresponds to the first packet of the data file. A bit value of 1 indicates that the packet was received; a value of 0 indicates that it was not received. The number is stored in the PDS radix notation of <radix>#<value>#.
